overview: Full-year 7th grade mathematics course aligned to Common Core standards (7.NS, 7.EE, 7.RP, 7.G, 7.SP). Builds fluency with rational numbers, proportional reasoning, expressions and equations, geometry, statistics, and probability — the foundation for algebra readiness.
naturalProgression: Shore up integer and fraction fluency in the Boot Camp
Build rational number operation skills with signed numbers and absolute value
Translate real-world situations into expressions and equations
Develop proportional reasoning through rates, percents, and scale
Identify and use proportional relationships in tables, graphs, and equations
Apply geometry formulas to area, surface area, and volume
Use data and probability to make predictions and draw conclusions
Bridge toward algebra with function thinking and pattern analysis

domains.7.NS: The Number System — apply and extend operations with rational numbers
domains.7.EE: Expressions & Equations — use properties to generate equivalent expressions, solve problems
domains.7.RP: Ratios & Proportional Relationships — analyze proportional relationships
domains.7.G: Geometry — solve problems involving scale, area, surface area, and volume
domains.7.SP: Statistics & Probability — use sampling, compare populations, develop probability models

aiInstructionModel.approach: AI-led gradual release for middle school learners
aiInstructionModel.description: The AI tutor leads instruction using the gradual release model (I Do / We Do / You Do), calibrated for 7th graders. Concepts are grounded in real-world contexts that matter to 12- and 13-year-olds. Emphasis on building number sense and confidence, not just procedures.

phases.aiRole: Introduce the concept with a real-world hook and clear definitions. Connect to what students already know from 6th grade.
phases.studentRole: Engage with the concept, ask questions, connect to prior knowledge

phases.aiRole: Walk through 2-3 worked examples with think-aloud reasoning. Show the 'why' behind each step, not just the 'how'.
phases.studentRole: Follow the reasoning, note patterns, ask clarifying questions

phases.aiRole: Present scaffolded problems. Ask guiding questions instead of giving answers. Provide hints only when the student is genuinely stuck.
phases.studentRole: Attempt each problem, explain reasoning, accept guidance when needed

phases.aiRole: Assign independent practice at mixed difficulty. Let the student struggle productively before intervening.
Deliver a short skill check (5-8 questions). Analyze performance and recommend next steps or remediation.
phases.studentRole: Complete the check, review mistakes, demonstrate understanding

aiDecisionRights: Choose which examples and problems to present based on observed gaps
Adjust difficulty in real-time based on student performance
Loop back to i-do if the student struggles in we-do
Skip ahead if the student demonstrates quick mastery
Spiral in prior skills (integer ops, fractions) when errors surface

modules.title: Start-of-Year Boot Camp
modules.preview: Fix the basics: integers, fractions, expressions, simple equations, and the coordinate plane
essentialQuestions: Can I add, subtract, multiply, and divide integers and fractions without hesitation?
Can I solve a basic equation and plot a point on the coordinate plane?

modules.title: Checkpoint: Boot Camp Diagnostic
modules.preview: Diagnostic assessment to identify skill gaps from 6th grade

modules.title: Rational Numbers & Operations
modules.preview: Add, subtract, multiply, and divide rational numbers — master signed number fluency (7.NS)
essentialQuestions: Why does subtracting a negative give the same result as adding a positive?
How do I decide the sign of my answer when multiplying or dividing?

modules.title: Expressions & Equations
modules.preview: Translate, simplify, solve multi-step equations and inequalities (7.EE)
essentialQuestions: How do I turn a word problem into an equation I can solve?
What changes when I solve an inequality vs. an equation?

modules.title: Checkpoint: Quarter 1 (Rational Numbers + Expressions & Equations)
modules.preview: Assessment covering Units 1-2: rational number operations, expressions, equations, and inequalities

modules.title: Ratios, Rates, and Proportions
modules.preview: Unit rates, proportional reasoning, scale drawings, and percent applications (7.RP)
essentialQuestions: How do I use a unit rate to compare two options?
How are discounts, tax, tips, and markups all just percent problems?

modules.title: Proportional Relationships
modules.preview: Identify, graph, and write equations for proportional relationships — y = kx (7.RP)
essentialQuestions: How do I tell if a relationship is proportional from a table, graph, or equation?
What does the constant of proportionality actually mean in context?

modules.title: Checkpoint: Quarter 2 (Ratios, Proportions, and Proportional Relationships)
modules.preview: Assessment covering Units 3-4: rates, proportions, percents, and proportional relationships

modules.title: Geometry and Measurement
modules.preview: Area, circumference, surface area, volume, composite figures, and cross-sections (7.G)
essentialQuestions: How do I break a composite figure into shapes I already know?
What is the difference between surface area and volume, and when do I use each?

modules.title: Statistics: Sampling and Inference
modules.preview: Populations, samples, random sampling, comparing groups, and drawing conclusions from data (7.SP)
essentialQuestions: Why does it matter HOW you collect a sample?
How do I use measures of center and variability to compare two groups?

modules.title: Checkpoint: Quarter 3 (Geometry + Statistics)
modules.preview: Assessment covering Units 5-6: geometry, measurement, sampling, and data analysis

modules.title: Probability
modules.preview: Simple and compound events, experimental vs. theoretical probability, simulations (7.SP)
essentialQuestions: What is the difference between what SHOULD happen and what DOES happen?
How do I organize outcomes for compound events so I don't miss any?

modules.title: Advanced Expressions & Intro to Functions
modules.preview: Deeper equation work, function thinking, and patterns — bridge to 8th grade (7.EE + 8.F preview)
essentialQuestions: How do I set up equations for geometry and percent word problems?
What makes a relationship a function, and how do I find the rule?

modules.title: Checkpoint: Quarter 4 (Probability + Advanced Expressions & Functions)
modules.preview: Assessment covering Units 7-8: probability, expressions, equations, and function thinking

modules.title: End-of-Year Mastery Review & Final Exam
modules.preview: Cumulative assessment across all 7th grade domains: 7.NS, 7.EE, 7.RP, 7.G, 7.SP

spiralStrategy.weeklyQuiz: Mostly prior skills: signed numbers, proportions, equations (10-15 min)
spiralStrategy.monthlyCheck: Mixed: proportional reasoning + integer ops + multi-step equations

aiGuidanceNotes: For 7th grade, signed number fluency is the make-or-break skill. Students who can't operate with negatives will struggle everywhere. Spiral integer operations into every unit. Proportional reasoning is the second pillar — it connects fractions, percents, rates, and scale into one big idea. When students see that connection, everything clicks.
